alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 8:05PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Carroll, Guernsey, Harrison and Tuscarawas. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM EST, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Carrollton, Freeport, Dennison, Gnadenhutten, Antrim, Tuscarawas, Midvale, Port Washington, Bowerston, Barnhill, Dellroy, Sherrodsville, Roswell, Stone Creek, Leesville, Stillwater and Tippecanoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
